title.narrative: Credit and Financial Services: Rural Financial Intermediation Programme II

description.narrative: The overall development objective of the programme is to provide access to a range of financial services for an estimated 6.9 million rural households by 30 June 2019; an increase of over 100 percent from a baseline of about 3.3 million households as at 30 June 2012. This will is achievable through support to a nationwide network of strong, vibrant and sustainable rural financial institutions oriented for engagement with poor.The key policy and institutional objectives include: enhanced human resource capacity and IT support; improved ownership and governance; micro insurance policy framework developed; improved targeting and client literacy; improved social performance standards; improved self-regulatory; grievance redressing mechanisms implemented; effective linkages with commercial banks established; for raising resources; micro insurance policy and associated regulatory and supervisory framework implemented; and a sustainable, dynamic and vibrant rural financial institutions capable of expanding outreach in depth and breadth in place.

name.narrative: Credit and Financial Services: Rural Financial Intermediation Programme II

description.narrative: This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
